snippet: AMR said labor costs exceeded competitors’ by as much as $800 million a year and led to its bankruptcy filing.
abstract: Judge Sean Lane of United States Bankruptcy Court in Manhattan rules that AMR Corporation's American Airlines is allowed to throw out its its labor agreement with Allied Pilots Association, ending a dispute with the only union it had failed to reach a deal with on concessions as it goes through bankruptcy reorganization.
lead_paragraph: AMR said labor costs exceeded competitors’ by as much as $800 million a year and led to its bankruptcy filing.

headline.seo: Judge Allows AMR to Reject Pilot Contract
headline.main: Judge Allows AMR to End Pilot Contract
headline.print_headline: Judge Allows AMR to End Pilot Contract
